metadata.title: A Formal Theory of Commonsense Psychology: How People Think People Think
metadata.authors: Andrew S. Gordon and Jerry R. Hobbs
metadata.description: Chapter 49 axioms covering emotions, intensity, happiness, sadness, raw emotions, cognitively elaborated emotions, liking, and emotional states
metadata.notation: First-order logic with reified eventualities, defeasible reasoning, and emotional predicates

axioms.title: Definition of emotionalState
axioms.fol: (forall (e p) (if (emotionalState e p)(and (eventuality e)(person p))))
axioms.english: If e is an emotional state in person p, then e is an eventuality and p is a person

axioms.title: Intensity based on importance
axioms.fol: (forall (p e1 e2 e3 e4) (if (and (emotionalState e1 p)(emotionalState e2 p) (cause e3 e1)(cause e4 e2) (moreImportant e3 e4 p)(etc)) (moreIntense e1 e2 p)))
axioms.english: If emotional states e1 and e2 in person p are caused by e3 and e4 respectively, and e3 is more important to p than e4, then defeasibly e1 is more intense than e2

axioms.title: Intensity based on event size
axioms.fol: (forall (p e1 e2 e3 e4) (if (and (emotionalState e1 p)(emotionalState e2 p) (cause e3 e1)(cause e4 e2) (subevent e4 e3)(etc)) (moreIntense e1 e2 p)))
axioms.english: If emotional states e1 and e2 in person p are caused by e3 and e4 respectively, and e4 is a subevent of e3, then defeasibly e1 is more intense than e2

axioms.title: Intensity based on response size
axioms.fol: (forall (p e1 e2 e3 e4) (if (and (emotionalState e1 p)(emotionalState e2 p) (cause e1 e3)(cause e2 e4) (subevent e4 e3)(etc)) (moreIntense e1 e2 p)))
axioms.english: If emotional states e1 and e2 in person p cause responses e3 and e4 respectively, and e4 is a subevent of e3, then defeasibly e1 is more intense than e2

axioms.title: Definition of intense emotional state
axioms.fol: (forall (p e0 e1 e2 s0 s s1) (if (and (forall (e) (if (member e s0)(emotionalState e p))) (moreIntense' e0 e1 e2 p)(scaleDefinedBy s s0 e0)(Hi s1 s)) (forall (e) (iff (intense e p)(inScale e s1)))))
axioms.english: An emotional state is intense if it is in the Hi region of the moreIntense scale for a person

axioms.title: Intense happiness causes arousal
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 p) (if (and (happy' e1 p)(intense e1 p)(etc)) (exists (e2) (and (aroused' e2 p)(cause e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: Intense happiness defeasibly causes arousal

axioms.title: Intense anger causes arousal
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 p) (if (and (angry' e1 p)(intense e1 p)(etc)) (exists (e2) (and (aroused' e2 p)(cause e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: Intense anger defeasibly causes arousal

axioms.title: Intense fear causes arousal
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 p) (if (and (afraid' e1 p)(intense e1 p)(etc)) (exists (e2) (and (aroused' e2 p)(cause e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: Intense fear defeasibly causes arousal

axioms.title: Arousal caused by intense emotion
axioms.fol: (forall (e2 p) (if (and (aroused' e2 p)(etc)) (exists (e1) (and (emotionalState e1 p)(intense e1 p) (cause e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: If someone is aroused, then defeasibly some intense emotional state caused it

axioms.title: Arousal causes focus on current world
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 p) (if (and (aroused' e1 p)(etc)) (exists (e2 e) (and (inFocus' e2 e p)(cwu e p)(cause e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: Arousal defeasibly causes a person to have the current world understanding in focus

axioms.title: Goals cause happiness
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 p) (if (and (goal e1 p)(etc)) (exists (e2) (and (happy' e2 p)(cause e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: If an eventuality is a goal of a person and it occurs, it defeasibly causes happiness

axioms.title: Anticipation of goal satisfaction causes happiness
axioms.fol: (forall (p e e1 e2 e3 t1 t2) (if (and (atTime' e1 e t2)(goal e1 p)(believe' e2 p e1) (atTime' e3 e2 t1)(before t1 t2)(etc)) (exists (e4 e5) (and (happy' e4 p)(atTime' e5 e4 t1)(cause e3 e5)))))
axioms.english: Believing that a future goal will be satisfied defeasibly causes present happiness

axioms.title: HappyThat from goal satisfaction
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 p) (if (and (goal e1 p)(etc)) (exists (e2) (and (happyThat' e2 p e1)(cause e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: If an eventuality is a goal of a person and it occurs, it defeasibly causes the person to be happy that it occurred

axioms.title: HappyThat implies happy
axioms.fol: (forall (p e) (if (happyThat p e)(happy p)))
axioms.english: Being happy that something happened implies being happy

axioms.title: Happiness resists belief change
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 p e2 s1 s2) (if (and (happy' e1 p)(changeBeliefSet' e2 p s1 s2)(etc)) (exists (e3) (and (not' e3 e2)(cause e1 e3)))))
axioms.english: Happiness tends to cause a person not to change their beliefs

axioms.title: Happiness causes action on beliefs
axioms.fol: (forall (p e1 e2 e3 e4) (if (and (happy' e1 p)(goal e2 p)(believe p e3) (cause' e3 e4 e2)(agentOf p e4)(etc)) (cause e1 e4)))
axioms.english: Happiness tends to cause a person to act on their beliefs to achieve goals

axioms.title: Goal non-satisfaction causes sadness
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 p e2) (if (and (goal e1 p)(not' e2 e1)(etc)) (exists (e3) (and (sad' e3 p)(cause e2 e3)))))
axioms.english: If a goal is not satisfied, this defeasibly causes sadness

axioms.title: Anticipation of goal failure causes sadness
axioms.fol: (forall (p e e0 e1 e2 e3 t1 t2) (if (and (atTime' e1 e t2)(not' e0 e1)(goal e1 p) (believe' e2 p e0)(atTime' e3 e2 t1) (before t1 t2)(etc)) (exists (e4 e5) (and (sad' e4 p)(atTime' e5 e4 t1)(cause e3 e5)))))
axioms.english: Believing that a future goal will not be satisfied defeasibly causes present sadness

axioms.title: Sadness suppresses action
axioms.fol: (forall (p e1 e2 e3 e4) (if (and (sad' e1 p)(goal e2 p)(believe p e3)(cause' e3 e4 e2) (agentOf p e4)(etc)) (exists (e5) (and (not' e5 e4)(cause e1 e5)))))
axioms.english: Sadness tends to cause a person not to act even when they believe an action would achieve a goal

axioms.title: Sadness causes belief change
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 p) (if (and (sad' e1 p)(etc)) (exists (e2 s1 s2) (and (changeBeliefSet' e2 p s1 s2)(cause e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: Sadness tends to cause a person to change their beliefs

axioms.title: Unhappiness excludes happiness
axioms.fol: (forall (p) (if (unhappy p)(not (happy p))))
axioms.english: If a person is unhappy, they are not happy

axioms.title: Sadness implies unhappiness
axioms.fol: (forall (p) (if (sad p)(unhappy p)))
axioms.english: If a person is sad, they are unhappy

axioms.title: Joyful from long-term goals
axioms.fol: (forall (e p) (if (and (joyful' e p)(etc)) (exists (e1) (and (cause e1 e)(longTermGoal e1 p)))))
axioms.english: Being joyful is defeasibly caused by achieving long-term goals

axioms.title: Long-term goals persist
axioms.fol: (forall (e p e1 t1 t2) (if (and (longTermGoal e p)(goal' e1 e p)(atTime e1 t1) (before t1 t2)(etc)) (atTime e1 t2)))
axioms.english: Long-term goals tend to persist through time

axioms.title: Vindication from correct prediction
axioms.fol: (forall (p x e1 e2 e3 e4 e5) (if (and (agentOf p e1)(cause' e4 e1 e2)(believe x e4) (badFor e2 p)(cause' e5 e1 e3)(goodFor e3 p)(etc)) (exists (e6) (and (vindicated' e6 p e1)(cause e5 e6)))))
axioms.english: If someone predicts your action will have bad consequences but it has good consequences, you feel vindicated

axioms.title: Vindication implies happiness
axioms.fol: (forall (p e1) (if (vindicated p e1)(happy p)))
axioms.english: If a person feels vindicated, they are happy

axioms.title: Pleased defeasibly implies happyThat
axioms.fol: (forall (p e) (if (and (pleased p e)(etc))(happyThat p e)))
axioms.english: Being pleased about something defeasibly implies being happy that it happened

axioms.title: Glad implies happyThat
axioms.fol: (forall (p e) (if (glad p e)(happyThat p e)))
axioms.english: Being glad about something implies being happy that it happened

axioms.title: Cheerfulness causes social interaction
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 p1) (if (and (cheerful' e1 p1)(etc)) (exists (e2 p2) (and (interact' e2 p1 p2)(cause e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: Cheerfulness defeasibly causes social interaction with others

axioms.title: Jubilant as intense cheerfulness
axioms.fol: (forall (e p) (if (jubilant' e p) (and (cheerful' e p)(intense e p))))
axioms.english: Being jubilant is being cheerful and intense

axioms.title: Elated as intense happiness
axioms.fol: (forall (e p) (if (elated' e p) (and (happy' e p)(intense e p))))
axioms.english: Being elated is being happy and intense

axioms.title: Euphoric as very intensely happy
axioms.fol: (forall (p e e0 s0 s1) (if (and (elated' e0 p)(scaleFor s0 e0)(Hi s1 s0) (euphoric' e p)) (exists (e1) (and (happy' e1 p)(gen e1 e)(inScale e1 s1)))))
axioms.english: Euphoria is happiness in the high region of the elated scale

axioms.title: Definition of eliminateThreat
axioms.fol: (forall (p x g) (iff (eliminateThreat p x g) (exists (e0 e1 e2 e3) (and (threat' e0 x p g)(cause p e1)(changeIn' e1 x) (cause e1 e2)(changeTo' e2 e3)(not' e3 e0)))))
axioms.english: To eliminate a threat is to change the threatening entity so it is no longer threatening

axioms.title: Eliminable threat causes anger
axioms.fol: (forall (x p g e1 e2 e3 c) (if (and (threat' e1 x p g)(believe p e2)(possible' e2 e3 c)(cwu c p) (eliminateThreat' e3 p x g)(etc)) (exists (e4) (and (angry' e4 p)(cause e1 e4)))))
axioms.english: A threat that a person believes they can eliminate defeasibly causes anger

axioms.title: AngryAt and angryThat from eliminable threat
axioms.fol: (forall (x p g e1 e2 e3 c) (if (and (threat' e1 x p g)(believe p e2)(possible' e2 e3 c)(cwu c t) (eliminateThreat' e3 p x g)(etc)) (exists (e4 e5 e6) (and (angryAt' e4 p x)(cause e1 e4) (or (and (eventuality x)(angryThat' e5 p x) (cause e1 e5)) (and (not (eventuality x))(arg* x e6) (threat e6 p g)(angryThat' e5 p e6) (cause e1 e5)))))))
axioms.english: A person can be angry at the threat source and angry that the threatening situation exists

axioms.title: Anger causes attempt to eliminate threat
axioms.fol: (forall (x p g e1 e2) (if (and (angry' e1 p)(threat' e2 x p g)(cause e2 e1)(etc)) (exists (e3 e4) (and (try' e3 p e4)(eliminateThreat' e4 p x g) (cause e1 e3)))))
axioms.english: Anger defeasibly causes attempts to eliminate the threat that caused the anger

axioms.title: Anger implies unhappiness
axioms.fol: (forall (p) (if (angry p)(unhappy p)))
axioms.english: If a person is angry, they are unhappy

axioms.title: Definition of avoidThreat
axioms.fol: (forall (p x g) (iff (avoidThreat p x g) (exists (e0 e1 e2 e3) (and (threat' e0 x p g)(cause p e1)(changeIn' e1 p) (cause e1 e2)(changeTo' e2 e3)(not' e3 e0)))))
axioms.english: To avoid a threat is to change oneself so the threat is no longer threatening

axioms.title: Non-eliminable threat causes fear
axioms.fol: (forall (x p g e1 e2 e3 e4 c) (if (and (threat' e1 x p g)(believe p e2)(not' e2 e3) (possible' e3 e4 c)(cwu c p)(eliminateThreat' e4 p x g)(etc)) (exists (e5) (and (afraid' e5 p)(cause e1 e5)))))
axioms.english: A threat that a person believes they cannot eliminate defeasibly causes fear

axioms.title: Fear causes attempt to avoid threat
axioms.fol: (forall (x p g e1 e2) (if (and (afraid' e1 p)(threat' e2 x p g)(cause e2 e1)(etc)) (exists (e3 e4) (and (try' e3 p e4)(avoidThreat' e4 p x g) (cause e1 e3)))))
axioms.english: Fear defeasibly causes attempts to avoid the threat that caused the fear

axioms.title: Inside implies interior
axioms.fol: (forall (x p) (if (inside x p)(interior x p)))
axioms.english: If something is inside a person, it is interior to them

axioms.title: In-group members are interior
axioms.fol: (forall (p1 p2 s) (if (and (person p1)(member p1 s)(person p2)(member p2 s)) (interior p2 p1)))
axioms.english: Members of the same group are interior to each other

axioms.title: Definition of ejectThreat
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 p x g) (iff (ejectThreat' e1 p x g) (exists (e2 e3) (and (threat x p g)(interior' e2 x p)(cause p e3) (changeFrom' e3 e2)(gen e3 e1)))))
axioms.english: To eject a threat is to cause it to change from being interior to not being interior

axioms.title: Interior threat causes disgust
axioms.fol: (forall (x p g e1) (if (and (threat' e1 x p g)(interior x p)) (exists (e2) (and (disgusted' e2 p)(cause e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: An interior threat defeasibly causes disgust

axioms.title: Disgust causes attempt to eject threat
axioms.fol: (forall (x p g e1 e2) (if (and (disgusted' e1 p)(threat' e2xpg)(cause e2 e1)(etc)) (exists (e3 e4) (and (try' e3 p e4)(ejectThreat' e4 p x g) (cause e1 e3)))))
axioms.english: Disgust defeasibly causes attempts to eject the threat that caused the disgust

axioms.title: Disgust implies unhappiness
axioms.fol: (forall (p) (if (disgusted p)(unhappy p)))
axioms.english: If a person feels disgusted, they are unhappy

axioms.title: Definition of inGroup
axioms.fol: (forall (p1 p2) (iff (inGroup p1 p2) (exists (s g) (and (member p1 s)(member p2 s)(sharedGoal g s)))))
axioms.english: A person is in your in-group if you share a goal

axioms.title: Definition of outGroup
axioms.fol: (forall (p1 p2) (iff (outGroup p1 p2) (exists (g1 g2) (or (competitiveGoals g1 g2 p1 p2) (adversarialGoals g1 p1 p2)))))
axioms.english: A person is in your out-group if you have competitive or adversarial goals

axioms.title: Good for in-group causes happiness for them
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 p1 p2) (if (and (goodFor e1 p2)(inGroup p1 p2)(etc)) (exists (e2) (and (happyFor' e2 p1 p2)(cause e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: Something good for an in-group member defeasibly causes you to be happy for them

axioms.title: HappyFor implies happy
axioms.fol: (forall (p1 p2) (if (happyFor p1 p2) (happy p1)))
axioms.english: Being happy for someone implies being happy

axioms.title: Bad for in-group causes sorrow for them
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 p1 p2) (if (and (badFor e1 p2)(inGroup p1 p2)(etc)) (exists (e2) (and (sorryFor' e2 p1 p2)(cause e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: Something bad for an in-group member defeasibly causes you to be sorry for them

axioms.title: SorryFor implies sadness
axioms.fol: (forall (p1 p2) (if (sorryFor p1 p2) (sad p1)))
axioms.english: Being sorry for someone implies being sad

axioms.title: Good for out-group causes resentment
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 p1 p2) (if (and (goodFor e1 p2)(outGroup p1 p2)(etc)) (exists (e2) (and (resent' e2 p1 p2)(cause e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: Something good for an out-group member defeasibly causes you to resent them

axioms.title: Resentment implies anger
axioms.fol: (forall (p1 p2) (if (and (resent p1 p2)(etc)) (angry p1)))
axioms.english: Resenting someone defeasibly implies being angry

axioms.title: Resentment implies unhappiness
axioms.fol: (forall (p1 p2) (if (resent p1 p2) (unhappy p1)))
axioms.english: Resenting someone implies being unhappy

axioms.title: Bad for out-group causes gloating
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 p1 p2) (if (and (badFor e1 p2)(outGroup p1 p2)(etc)) (exists (e2) (and (gloat' e2 p1 p2)(cause e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: Something bad for an out-group member defeasibly causes you to gloat

axioms.title: Gloating implies happiness
axioms.fol: (forall (p1 p2) (if (gloat p1 p2) (happy p1)))
axioms.english: Gloating about someone implies being happy

axioms.title: Definition of anticipate
axioms.fol: (forall (p e) (iff (anticipate p e) (exists (e1 e2 e3 d) (and (gbel' e1 p e d)(gt d 0) (envisionFromTo' e2 p e3 e)(cwu e3 p) (cause e2 e1)))))
axioms.english: To anticipate an event is to have nonzero graded belief in it from envisioning from current world understanding

axioms.title: Definition of hope
axioms.fol: (forall (p e) (iff (hope p e) (and (anticipate p e)(goodFor e p))))
axioms.english: Hope is anticipating something good for you

axioms.title: Definition of fear2
axioms.fol: (forall (p e) (iff (fear2 p e) (and (anticipate p e)(badFor e p))))
axioms.english: Fear-2 is anticipating something bad for you

axioms.title: Hope defeasibly causes happiness
axioms.fol: (forall (p e) (if (and (hope p e)(etc))(happy p)))
axioms.english: Hope defeasibly causes happiness

axioms.title: Hope suppresses unhappiness
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 p e) (if (and (hope' e1 p e)(etc)) (exists (e2 e3) (and (not' e2 e3)(unhappy' e3 p)(cause e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: Hope tends to cause one not to be unhappy

axioms.title: Fear2 defeasibly causes fear
axioms.fol: (forall (p e) (if (and (fear2 p e)(etc))(afraid p)))
axioms.english: Fear-2 defeasibly causes raw fear

axioms.title: Fear2 implies unhappiness
axioms.fol: (forall (p e) (if (fear2 p e)(unhappy p)))
axioms.english: Fear-2 implies unhappiness

axioms.title: Satisfaction from anticipated good event occurring
axioms.fol: (forall (p e e1) (iff (and (anticipate p e)(anticipate p e1)(not' e1 e) (goodFor e p)(etc)) (exists (e2) (and (satisfied' e2 p e)(cause e e2)))))
axioms.english: Satisfaction results when an anticipated good event occurs

axioms.title: Satisfaction implies happiness
axioms.fol: (forall (p e) (if (satisfied p e)(happy p)))
axioms.english: Being satisfied implies being happy

axioms.title: Disappointment from anticipated good event not occurring
axioms.fol: (forall (p e e1) (iff (and (anticipate p e)(anticipate p e1)(not' e1 e) (goodFor e p)(etc)) (exists (e2) (and (disappointed' e2 p e)(cause e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: Disappointment results when an anticipated good event does not occur

axioms.title: Disappointment implies sadness
axioms.fol: (forall (p e) (if (disappointed p e)(sad p)))
axioms.english: Being disappointed implies being sad

axioms.title: Fears confirmed from anticipated bad event occurring
axioms.fol: (forall (p e e1) (iff (and (anticipate p e)(anticipate p e1)(not' e1 e) (badFor e p)(etc)) (exists (e2) (and (fearsConfirmed' e2 p e)(cause e e2)))))
axioms.english: Fears are confirmed when an anticipated bad event occurs

axioms.title: Fears confirmed defeasibly implies sadness
axioms.fol: (forall (p e) (if (and (fearsConfirmed p e)(etc))(sad p)))
axioms.english: Having fears confirmed defeasibly implies sadness

axioms.title: Fears confirmed implies unhappiness
axioms.fol: (forall (p e) (if (fearsConfirmed p e)(unhappy p)))
axioms.english: Having fears confirmed implies unhappiness

axioms.title: Relief from anticipated bad event not occurring
axioms.fol: (forall (p e e1) (iff (and (anticipate p e)(anticipate p e1)(not' e1 e) (badFor e p)(etc)) (exists (e2) (and (relief' e2 p e)(cause e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: Relief results when an anticipated bad event does not occur

axioms.title: Relief implies happiness
axioms.fol: (forall (p e) (if (relief p e)(happy p)))
axioms.english: Feeling relief implies being happy

axioms.title: Person is in their own in-group
axioms.fol: (forall (p) (if (person p)(inGroup p p)))
axioms.english: A person is in their own in-group

axioms.title: Pride from in-group attempting difficult good action
axioms.fol: (forall (e p1 p2 e1) (if (and (inGroup p1 p2)(goodFor e p1)(difficult e p2) (agentOf p2 e)(try' e1 p2 e)(etc)) (exists (e2) (and (proud' e2 p1 e)(cause e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: Pride results when an in-group member attempts something difficult and good

axioms.title: Pride implies happiness
axioms.fol: (forall (p e) (if (proud p e)(happy p)))
axioms.english: Being proud implies being happy

axioms.title: Gratification from in-group succeeding at difficult good action
axioms.fol: (forall (e p1 p2 e1) (if (and (inGroup p1 p2)(goodFor e p1)(difficult e p2) (agentOf p2 e)(succeed' e1 p2 e)(etc)) (exists (e2) (and (gratified' e2 p1 e)(cause e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: Gratification results when an in-group member succeeds at something difficult and good

axioms.title: Gratification implies pride
axioms.fol: (forall (p e) (if (gratified p e)(proud p e)))
axioms.english: Being gratified implies being proud

axioms.title: Appreciation from other attempting difficult good action
axioms.fol: (forall (e p1 p2 e1) (if (and (nequal p1 p2)(goodFor e p1)(difficult e p2) (agentOf p2 e)(try' e1 p2 e)(etc)) (exists (e2) (and (appreciative' e2 p1 e)(cause e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: Appreciation results when someone else attempts something difficult and good for you

axioms.title: Appreciation defeasibly implies happiness
axioms.fol: (forall (p e) (if (and (appreciative p e)(etc))(happy p)))
axioms.english: Being appreciative defeasibly implies being happy

axioms.title: Gratitude from other succeeding at difficult good action
axioms.fol: (forall (e p1 p2 e1) (if (and (nequal p1 p2)(goodFor e p1)(difficult e p2) (agentOf p2 e)(succeed' e1 p2 e)(etc)) (exists (e2) (and (grateful' e2 p1 e)(cause e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: Gratitude results when someone else succeeds at something difficult and good for you

axioms.title: Gratitude implies appreciation
axioms.fol: (forall (p e) (if (grateful p e)(appreciative p e)))
axioms.english: Being grateful implies being appreciative

axioms.title: Self-reproach from attempting bad action for self
axioms.fol: (forall (e p e1) (if (and (badFor e p)(agentOf p e)(try' e1 p e)(etc)) (exists (e2) (and (selfReproachful' e2 p e)(cause e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: Self-reproach results from attempting something bad for oneself

axioms.title: Self-reproach defeasibly implies anger
axioms.fol: (forall (p e) (if (and (selfReproachful p e)(etc))(angry p)))
axioms.english: Self-reproach defeasibly implies anger at oneself

axioms.title: Remorse from succeeding at bad action for self
axioms.fol: (forall (e p e1) (if (and (badFor e p)(agentOf p e)(succeed' e1 p e)(etc)) (exists (e2) (and (remorse' e2 p e)(cause e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: Remorse results from succeeding at something bad for oneself

axioms.title: Remorse implies self-reproach
axioms.fol: (forall (p e) (if (remorse p e)(selfReproachful p e)))
axioms.english: Feeling remorse implies feeling self-reproach

axioms.title: Remorse defeasibly implies sadness
axioms.fol: (forall (p e) (if (and (remorse p e)(etc))(sad p)))
axioms.english: Feeling remorse defeasibly implies sadness

axioms.title: Embarrassment from in-group disapproval
axioms.fol: (forall (p1 p2 s e1 e2) (if (and (succeed' e1 p1 e)(badFor e p1)(nequal p1 p2) (inGroup p1 p2)(doubleton s p1 p2)(believe p2 e2) (badFor' e2 e s)(etc)) (exists (e3)(and (embarrassed' e3 p1 e)(cause e1 e3)))))
axioms.english: Embarrassment results when you succeed at something bad and an in-group member disapproves

axioms.title: Reproach from other attempting bad action for you
axioms.fol: (forall (e p1 p2 e1) (if (and (nequal p1 p2)(badFor e p1) (agentOf p2 e)(try' e1 p2 e)(etc)) (exists (e2) (and (reproachful' e2 p1 e)(cause e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: Reproach results when someone else attempts something bad for you

axioms.title: Reproach defeasibly implies anger
axioms.fol: (forall (p e) (if (and (reproachful p e)(etc))(angry p)))
axioms.english: Feeling reproachful defeasibly implies anger

axioms.title: Anger-2 from other succeeding at bad action for you
axioms.fol: (forall (e p1 p2 e1) (if (and (nequal p1 p2)(badFor e p1) (agentOf p2 e)(succeed' e1 p2 e)(etc)) (exists (e2) (and (angry2' e2 p1 e)(cause e1 e2)))))
axioms.english: Anger-2 results when someone else succeeds at something bad for you

axioms.title: Anger-2 implies reproach
axioms.fol: (forall (p e) (if (angry2 p e)(reproachful p e)))
axioms.english: Feeling anger-2 implies feeling reproachful

axioms.title: Jealousy from competitive goals
axioms.fol: (forall (p g p1 g1 p2 g2) (if (and (person p1)(person p2)(arg* p g) (subst p1 g1 p g)(subst p2 g2 p g) (competitiveGoals g1 g2 p1 p2)(etc)) (exists (e1) (and (jealous' e1 p1 g2)(cause g2 e1)))))
axioms.english: Jealousy results when someone achieves a goal competitive with yours

axioms.title: Envy from unachieved similar goals
axioms.fol: (forall (p g p1 g1 p2 g2) (if (and (person p1)(person p2)(arg* p g) (subst p1 g1 p g)(subst p2 g2 p g) (goal g1 p1)(goal g2 p2)(not g1)(etc)) (exists (e1) (and (envious' e1 p1 g2)(cause g2 e1)))))
axioms.english: Envy results when someone achieves a goal similar to your unachieved goal

axioms.title: Jealousy defeasibly implies anger
axioms.fol: (forall (p e) (if (and (jealous p e)(etc))(angry p)))
axioms.english: Jealousy defeasibly implies anger

axioms.title: Envy defeasibly implies sadness
axioms.fol: (forall (p e) (if (and (envious p e)(etc))(sad p)))
axioms.english: Envy defeasibly implies sadness

axioms.title: Jealousy implies unhappiness
axioms.fol: (forall (p e) (if (jealous p e)(unhappy p)))
axioms.english: Jealousy implies unhappiness

axioms.title: Envy implies unhappiness
axioms.fol: (forall (p e) (if (envious p e)(unhappy p)))
axioms.english: Envy implies unhappiness

axioms.title: Liking from causing happiness
axioms.fol: (forall (e e1 e2 p) (if (and (eventuality e)(cause' e1 e e2)(happy' e2 p)(etc)) (exists (e3) (and (like' e3 p e)(cause e1 e3)))))
axioms.english: If something causes happiness, it defeasibly causes liking

axioms.title: Liking causes happiness
axioms.fol: (forall (p e) (if (and (eventuality e)(like p e)(etc)) (exists (e1) (and (happy' e1 p)(cause e e1)))))
axioms.english: Liking something defeasibly causes it to make you happy

axioms.title: Liking eventuality implies liking entity
axioms.fol: (forall (p e x) (if (and (eventuality e)(like p e)(arg* x e)(etc)) (like p x)))
axioms.english: Liking an eventuality defeasibly implies liking entities involved in it

axioms.title: Disliking from causing unhappiness
axioms.fol: (forall (e e1 e2 p) (if (and (eventuality e)(cause' e1 e e2) (unhappy' e2 p)(etc)) (exists (e3) (and (dislike' e3 p e)(cause e1 e3)))))
axioms.english: If something causes unhappiness, it defeasibly causes disliking

axioms.title: Disliking causes unhappiness
axioms.fol: (forall (p e) (if (and (eventuality e)(dislike p e)(etc)) (exists (e1) (and (unhappy' e1 p)(cause e e1)))))
axioms.english: Disliking something defeasibly causes it to make you unhappy

axioms.title: Disliking eventuality implies disliking entity
axioms.fol: (forall (p e x) (if (and (eventuality e)(dislike p e)(arg* x e)(etc)) (dislike p x)))
axioms.english: Disliking an eventuality defeasibly implies disliking entities involved in it

axioms.title: Love as intense liking
axioms.fol: (forall (e p x) (if (and (love' e p x)(Rexist e)(etc)) (and (like p x)(intense e p))))
axioms.english: Love is defeasibly intense liking

axioms.title: Hate as intense disliking
axioms.fol: (forall (e p x) (if (and (hate' e p x)(Rexist e)(etc)) (and (dislike p x)(intense e p))))
axioms.english: Hate is defeasibly intense disliking

axioms.title: Happy is emotional state
axioms.fol: (forall (e p) (if (happy' e p)(emotionalState e p)))
axioms.english: Being happy is an emotional state

axioms.title: Sad is emotional state
axioms.fol: (forall (e p) (if (sad' e p)(emotionalState e p)))
axioms.english: Being sad is an emotional state

axioms.title: Angry is emotional state
axioms.fol: (forall (e p) (if (angry' e p)(emotionalState e p)))
axioms.english: Being angry is an emotional state

axioms.title: Afraid is emotional state
axioms.fol: (forall (e p) (if (afraid' e p)(emotionalState e p)))
axioms.english: Being afraid is an emotional state

axioms.title: Disgusted is emotional state
axioms.fol: (forall (e p) (if (disgusted' e p)(emotionalState e p)))
axioms.english: Being disgusted is an emotional state

axioms.title: Definition of no emotion
axioms.fol: (forall (p) (iff (noEmotion p) (not (exists (e) (and (emotionalState e p)(Rexist e))))))
axioms.english: Having no emotion means no emotional state really exists

axioms.title: People normally have emotional states
axioms.fol: (forall (p t) (if (and (person p)(instant t)(etc)) (exists (e) (and (emotionalState e p)(atTime e t)))))
axioms.english: At any given time, a person defeasibly has some emotional state

axioms.title: People have explanations for emotions
axioms.fol: (forall (e p) (if (and (emotionalState e p)(etc)) (exists (e1 e2) (and (believe p e2)(cause' e2 e1 e)))))
axioms.english: People defeasibly believe something causes their emotional states

axioms.title: Definition of emotional state change
axioms.fol: (forall (e e1 e2 p) (iff (emotionalStateChange e e1 e2 p) (and (change' e e1 e2) (emotionalState e1 p)(emotionalState e2 p))))
axioms.english: Emotional state change is change between two emotional states

axioms.title: Emotional tendencies manifest at times
axioms.fol: (forall (p e t) (if (and (emotionalTendency p e)(instant t)(etc)) (exists (e1) (and (subst p e1 p e)(emotionalState e1 p) (atTime e1 t)))))
axioms.english: Emotional tendencies defeasibly manifest as actual emotional states at given times

axioms.title: Definition of emotional appraisal
axioms.fol: (forall (p e1 e) (iff (emotionalAppraisal p e1 e) (exists (e2) (and (changeTo e2)(believe' e2 p e1)(cause e2 e) (emotionalState e p)))))
axioms.english: Emotional appraisal is when a change in belief causes an emotional state

axioms.title: Emotions caused by appraisal
axioms.fol: (forall (e p) (if (and (emotionalState e p)(etc)) (exists (e1) (emotionalAppraisal p e1 e))))
axioms.english: Emotional states are defeasibly caused by emotional appraisal

axioms.title: Definition of coping strategy
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 p e2) (iff (copingStrategy e1 p e2) (exists (e3 e4 e5) (and (unhappy' e2 p)(believe p e3)(cause' e3 e1 e4) (change' e4 e2 e5)(happy' e5 p)))))
axioms.english: A coping strategy is actions that can change unhappiness to happiness

axioms.title: Definition of coping
axioms.fol: (forall (p e2) (iff (cope p e2) (exists (e1 e3) (and (unhappy' e2 p)(copingStrategy e1 p e2) (cause e1 e3)(changeFrom' e3 e2)))))
axioms.english: To cope is to employ a coping strategy to change from unhappiness

conversion_notes.reified_predicates: Extensive use of primed predicates like happy', sad', angry', afraid', disgusted' for emotional states
conversion_notes.defeasible_reasoning: 66 axioms use (etc) predicate showing extensive non-monotonic reasoning in emotion theory
conversion_notes.emotional_causation: Strong focus on causal relations between appraisal, emotional states, and behavioral responses
conversion_notes.intensity_framework: Sophisticated treatment of emotional intensity using scale theory from Chapter 12
conversion_notes.in_out_group_distinctions: Complex social categorization affecting emotional responses to others' successes/failures
conversion_notes.raw_vs_cognitive_emotions: Clear distinction between basic biological emotions (fear, anger, disgust) and cognitively elaborated emotions
conversion_notes.anticipation_framework: Future-oriented emotions based on graded belief and envisioning from current world understanding

file_format_notes.axiom_extraction: All 120 axioms from Chapter 49 successfully extracted
file_format_notes.fol_formatting: Preserved exact logical syntax including quantifiers, operators, and predicate arguments
file_format_notes.complexity_classification: Based on logical structure depth, quantifier nesting, and conceptual sophistication
file_format_notes.pattern_categorization: Systematic classification into major axiom types following established taxonomy
